AD_StatueBanter.synopsis: The spirit inside the Sentient Amulet, once a monk of Lathander, sees a statue of Lathander in the interior courtyard of the Gith Creche, once a Lathander monastery. Pilgrims of old used to visit the statue to see a holy relic - the Blood of Lathander - though unbeknownst to them, it was a fake prop. The Mad Monk reminisces about his own pilgrimage.
AD_StatueBanter.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CRE_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MonkAmulet_Get" and equip the amulet.- Approach the statue of Lathander in the Creche: S_CRE_MonkAmulet_StatueBanter_f83fe070-3bae-4996-a349-7e14f0a0573a"goto 75 9 62"

AD_BloodOfLathanderBanter.synopsis: The spirit inside the Sentient Amulet, once a monk of Lathander, sees the true Blood of Lathander displayed before us. This was a holy relic for which many devout followers made their pilgrimage to the monastery that eventually became the Gith Creche.
AD_BloodOfLathanderBanter.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CRE_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MonkAmulet_Get" and equip the amulet.- Approach the Blood of Lathander in the Creche: S_CRE_MonkAmulet_BloodOfLathanderBanter_4e40660b-9ea9-4716-9379-a521f333a920"goto 1077 3 -782"

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Both sessions involve the spirit inside the sentient amulet reacting to relics related to Lathander. In the AD_StatueBanter session, the spirit sees a statue that used to be revered by pilgrims, though it turns out to be a fake relic. In the AD_BloodOfLathanderBanter session, the true relic, the Blood of Lathander, is revealed. It makes narrative sense that the spirit’s reminiscence regarding the fake relic (the statue) would come before encountering the true relic. There is no indication that these sessions cannot coexist – rather, they appear to form consecutive layered pieces of the same story. Thus, AD_StatueBanter should occur before AD_BloodOfLathanderBanter.

AD_StatueBanter_1.text: Beloved Morninglord. I must request of thee a reverential reverie. HeheHEEEEE!

AD_StatueBanter_0.text: I visited this place in a forlorn and forgotten age, to lay mine eyes upon the Blood of Lathander.

AD_BloodOfLathanderBanter_0.text: The Blood of Lathander, as I barely live and hardly breathe. HahaHAhaha.
